p:
For proper results interpretation, we considered 4 signals: 1) target virus, 2) SPCV, 3) target IAC, and 4) SPCV IAC (
31 ). With cycle threshold (C t) <45, independently of corresponding IAC C t, the PCR result was considered positive. With C t >45 and corresponding IAC C t <45, results were interpreted as negative. When both targets and corresponding IACs showed C t >45, reactions were considered failed. When >1 replicate target assay (HEV or PAdV) was positive, the sample was considered positive. Absence of SPCV and its IAC signals indicated preamplification processes (virus concentration and extraction) failure (
31 ). In the presence of SPCV, SPCV IAC, and target IAC signals, target virus signal absence was conclusively indicating test negative result.
